name: VIK Hotel Arena Blanca

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friends and I are constantly looking for new places to visit. My family owns a timeshare and we searched getaways and found an unbelievably cheap rate for the Cayena Beach Club in Punta Cana. It turns out that it was, however the staff worked with us. The cheap rate for the hotel is evened out by the flux of the all-inclusive prices for which you have to pay for the entire week even if you're only staying for four days. We paid our rate and put it behind us, determined to make the best out of our vacation on the beautiful island. The hotel stay was very wonderful, be sure to brush up on your espanol, you will need to use some. Most of the travelers at the hotel were from various european country, and I can say were actually surprised to see young African-American ladies. So not only was there a language barrier, we often felt like we were spectacles. But not to worry we took it with a grain of salt, otherwise our trip went unscathed. The beach was BEAUTIFUL. We loved the hotel staff. Newton, was a wonderful bartender and I recommend looking for him personally. The staff was ready and willing, to meet any of our requests. I did read problems people had with finding a chair when they went to the beach, but we really didn't have a problem at all. The restaurant situation was a little confusing at first, but once we found all the restaurants it was great. There are like six of them, there are so many different things to choose from it was great. We really got every penny's worth. We definitely recommend going on one the ATV tour's through the island it was a humbling experience. The pools were great, but who could stay in the pool when there is crystal-clear water so close by. Although there were a lot of couples and families, I would definitely recommend the Cayena Beach Club to any young, fun-seekers who are willing to step out side the box. Punta Cana and the LTI had so many things to offer, you just have to be ready to experience new things. Oh yeah the animation staff were great as well. The time-share staff figured we were in high-school and therefore didn't even bother trying to sell us a time share. Lucky us!!!
reviews.title: Too Good to be True!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Property was very beautiful, The service staff catered to our needs. Before my arrival, actually three months prior, I Researched the hotel , Its Rooms And ammenities. I choose the superior (OCEAN VIEW ROOM) The listing boasts an ocean view , fruit basket, Bottle of rum, and souvenir( with seven day stay or more). USAIRWAYS VACATIONS.COM, with whom I booked my stay list and iron and ironing board and dataport in the room as well. Upon Arriving to our room, We discovered NONE OF THESE AMMENITIES. We Addressed this matter with the staff at the front desk and we were told that these items were not available and infact the front desk told us that in the matter of the iron that if they told the truth than we would not use their laundry service. and that we needed to take the matter up with our booking agent. We returned later and spoke with the customer service representative. She informed us that that was not the way they did business and the issue would be rectified. although still no iron, we arrived to our room after an all day excursion and found a fruit basket and bottle of rum. Other than that incident, our stay was very enjoyable, the food was good and the beach beautiful the strange thing was the bathroom which had a window paned door (NO PRIVACY) any other persons in the room could see right through to the toilet. There also were no face cloths, SO MAKE SURE YOU BRING AN IRON AND A WASHCLOTH. Everyone was very friendly, but that initial experience could be the difference of us returning of not. Call the hotel for amenities and any travel vouchers for transportation to and/or from the hotel.
reviews.title: What You Read Aint What You Get

likes.liked: — THE GROUNDS AND THE TOUR AGENT(MARIO)
likes.disliked: — THE MISREPRESENTATION OF THE AMMENITIES IN THE ROOM(SUPERIOR ROOM)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We just got back on Friday May 25th and we had a great time!! Booked at TNT Vacations. Before I left I read many reviews and was very skeptic, but I have to say I had NO disappointments. It is crazy how one person can say they had the worst time, and another their best time. I'm sure it does not compare to a Sandals resort, but you also pay a fraction of the price. For the price, if you go here you should not be disappointed.
reviews.title: Did not want to leave!! Beautiful and Clean Resort

likes.disliked: — Communication about shuttle back to airport was Poor. Shuttle was 1/2 hour late and we weren't even sure it was coming for us. We almost ended up paying for a taxi. It showed up once we were in the taxi then we switched cars because it would have been US33.00 to airport.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: A week before departing, I took another reviewers advice and emailed the facility to ask for Building 5. I also requested that another couple we are traveling with to be adjacent or close to our room They emailed me back saying they would do their best to fulfill our request.
reviews.title: Wonderful Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We left on May 18th from Boston. The flights went well. Our flight was at 6:15AM, but we arrived at the airport at 4AM, so US Air bumped our flight up to 5AM and gave us FIRST CLASS. That was a surprise, and my first time in First class. Much more comfortable. We had a layover in Charlotte and didn't have a problem finding something do to. Many restaurants and shops to keep us occupied. We departed Charlotte at 11AM and arrived at Punta Cana at 3PM. The airport is pretty much a big hut. Coming in there is a line and they take everyones picture with some Dominican ladies. You have to pay US10.00 per person to enter the country. They give you a tourist card, which you end up passing in after you get your passport stamped. You go through customs which was a breeze and then you get to were you would take a taxi or see your tour company. We booked through TNT vacations so it included shuttle to and from the hotel. We found the booth (it was Coco Tours in Punta Cana) and they led us to our shuttle. It is pretty hectic at the airport, many Dominicans insist on helping you with your luggage for tips. We let them help us with our luggage (6 bags for 4 of us) and we tipped 4.00 US. He was very happy with that.
reviews.title: Would definitely recommend
Awesome Place
reviews.text: My best friend and I just got back to Chicago, IL last night from a 6 day stay in Punta Cana at the LTI. We booked through cheap caribbean.com (great place to book travel and excellent prices). I have traveled many places outside the US and after we booked our trip my g-friend starting reading horrible things about the hotel; none of which are true. The staff was very friendly (a please and a thank you go along way), the rooms are very clean never had a problem with the towels or the pillows probably due to the fact that we tipped the maid everyday - well worth the money each day.(that is if you tip your maid $4.00 (US) a day). Be sure to bring your own travel mug as the glasses are very small and dont keep your drinks cold. The grounds were nicely kept (some spots could of used a coat of paint such as the patio railing, however keep in mind that Punta Cana is in the hurricane zone - and many other resorts look the same) the pool was very clean. The food was good (the italian and the poolside grill were the best). International was okay, its a buffet people it is what it is. Bring bug spray, sunscreen, travel mugs, a travel iron as they do not provide them. Have fun and enjoy LTI as I would return to this resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a week at LTI – Punta Cana, March 11 – 18, 2007 and had a very enjoyable time. As most of the postings are correct, we will add or confirm a few of our own experiences:
reviews.title: LTI - Great value for the right price

likes.liked: — Smaller resort with beautiful grounds, great beach and value for money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Arrival: Getting through the airport on arrival was fairly simple and quick. The resort is about 30 minutes from the airport, but with all of the stops to drop off guests at other resorts, the trip is well over an hour.
reviews.title: Great relaxing clean resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Resort: A bit “tired” looking but clean. The grounds were nice with lots of flowering bushes and palm trees. Expect about 70% or more of the guest to be German. Mainly adults, few kids, mainly around the pool during the day.
reviews.title: Had a bad experience
Must Read Review...lots of need to knows when travelling to DR
reviews.text: Tennis courts: If you are looking to play lots of tennis on your vacation, you’ll be disappointed. There are just 2 concrete courts covered with course sand. Guess it is a Caribbean version of “clay courts”. There are 2 resort organized tournaments, a singles tournament on Thursday and a doubles on Saturday. Four people turned up for the singles’ tournament. We passed on the doubles. Racquets and balls are available, free of charge.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: PowBill - Ontario, Canada
reviews.title: Fantastic Time

likes.liked: — The resort was beautifully looked after, clean.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date of Stay: Feb 3rd to 10th, 2008
reviews.title: Very Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We arrived at Punta Cana airport on Sunday Feb 3rd and were quickly taken to the LTI Beach Resort. The trip was made in a comfortable coach with stops along the way at other hotels. When we arrived at LTI we went to the registration desk to register and were given an upgraded room, Ocean View. The whole check-in experience took about 5 minutes and we were on our way to our room. When we arrived at our room, our luggage was already there. The room was on the ground floor with a view of the ocean. It had 2 twin beds pushed together instead of a king sized. The room was spacious and clean, we had no leaks as mentioned in some other reviews. The outside light on the terrace was burned out so we reported it to the registration desk and it was replaced right away. We were quite comfortable in the room and enjoyed sitting on the terrace in the mornings and evenings.
reviews.title: More a 3.5star, gorgeous beach, rude animation team

likes.liked: — Beach, smaller resort for ease of walking
likes.disliked: — Animation team apathy, bare rooms, would not give out cold milk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The resort is smaller than some that we've stayed in before with fewer bars and restaurants and only 1 swimming pool. We found this to be a good thing as we were able to meet and get to know people better than in a larger resort. In a smaller place, you tend to see the same people every day. We made some good friends and had a wonderful time around and in the pool. The afternoon activies put on by the Activation Team were always entertaining and audiance participation was always a part of it. The drinks were good and the beer was cold.
reviews.title: Basic but would reccomend this resort

likes.liked: — mature beautiful grounds with friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet restaurant had a terrifice selection of food, even the most picky eater should have no problem finding things they like. We didn't try any of the A-la-carte restaurants. The hamburgers, chicken and french fries available at the Buchaneer in the afternoon are great.
reviews.title: A Mixed Bag

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at LTI. I loved it. I read the reviews and was a little worried. This was my first all inclusive trip. Besides coming in at night to a frog in our room ( which cannot be helped), we had a very pleasant experience. The food was great. The staff was awesome and sooo friendly. Our room was cleaned every day. I was able to practice my spanish, even though the staff that you interact with all speak good english, among several other languages. I suppose I have learned to appreciate things in life. I had a wondeful time and would not hesitate to go back here. Thanks LTI for a memorable experience.
reviews.title: Loved LTI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Mainly room problems ie: smells & is damp, air conditioning not as cold as would like, not the cleanest rooms. Typically the beds were just made each day. Had sand on the floor all week, so it was obvious that no sweeping had occured. TV got 5 channels maybe. Locks on ground floor sliding glass doors did not work, so we were afraid for our valuables.
reviews.title: Overall good trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach was beautiful, the best part of the trip. Little shops were just a short walk down the beach, very good if you like art. Can haggle prices down pretty low.
reviews.title: Trapped in Paradise

likes.liked: — When it was time to leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disco was disapointing, not very lively. As the rest of the resort was also not very lively.
reviews.title: It is what it is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food was edible, pizza in italian resturant was very good though. Drinks were good.
reviews.title: Half 4 star, half 2 star

likes.liked: — Beach, pool, people, gardens, food, shows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LTI oversold their hotel, so they checked us in at their sister hotel, Ocean Blue, next door. We were able to use the facilities at both resorts, after haggling with the front desk.
reviews.title: LTI - average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool was relatively small and didn't include a swimup bar, which was disappointing.
reviews.title: Don't leave luggage with bellman

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food selection was very typical of an all-inclusive in the area. Pasta bar, stir fry station, sandwich station. Nothing spectular and certainly, not world class.
reviews.title: Not good for toddlers
Great Vacation
reviews.text: Resort was over-run with sales agents attempting to lure new timeshare customers and they were incredibly aggressive.

reviews.title: Just got back from a lovely trip
reviews.text: Tipping tending to get better service, in general.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The resort was the worst out of two previous we have stayed in (Copacabana in Riviera Maya and Riu Jalisco in Puerto Vallarta). In our room, three out of five power outlets did not work, including the one in the bathroom, which they replaced after our third complain. The same story was in all other three rooms where our friends stayed. When we first entered the room, instead of a king size bed we got two full size beds. They put them together and said that this is their standard room. Again, the same situation was in two other rooms. The bathroom door was with a see-through glass – crazy, I was able to see the toilet area right from the hallway where our closets were. There was some mold in the bathroom on the ceiling. The toilet would not flush in our friend’s room on the first day. They only make up our beds but did not change the linens all seven days.
reviews.title: Bad choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were four ”restaurants” – one “sea food” where were four options on the menu only one of them was a fish, others were pork, beef, and something else, all other sea food was on a separate menu and not included in the all-inclusive package (lobster cost was 30 USD); the second restaurant was a pizzeria and couple salads buffet ; the third restaurant was a small buffet with a very limited choice of food; and the last one, the main buffet, had the SAME selection of food the whole seven days stay (Other resorts we have been to had a different cousin every day). I would not recommend this resort to my friends. It was a bad choice.
reviews.title: Relaxation at it's finest!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the Caribbean and to say the least this resort is awesome! Smaller with more hands on service, waiters, waitress' were all professional and courteous. Some "Americans" wrote before we left that the english was horrible by the staff and they could not communicate with them. I don't care where you are from Canada, US or anywhere that is english dominant you will not find any resort that all the staff can speak parts of six languages. We heard German, Spanish, Italian, French, Swiss and of course English. If you gave them a moment the language barrier would slowly fall and if you paid attention you could pick up some Spanish. The food was incredible, no matter which restaurant or buffet we never once had a bad meal. So as to all those bad reviews out there I swear to you vacationers wanting to go to the LTI your experience if you want to relax and enjoy some wonderful beaches and water this resort is incredible!! I promise it. We are going back there to get married.
reviews.title: Foget about it! SERIOUSLY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Absolutelly unfriendly staff starting with the reception desk, ending to bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: We had a great time!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The receptionist Juan answers in absolute indifference , with both hands deeply througn in the pockets and showing a clever smile that wherever we have booked a room with a seaview the only room available is one with a restaurant view, as they sell that room as "sea view' one!
reviews.title: Nice Time!

likes.liked: — The many restsurants,o premises and the 'All inclusive',package.The NO SMOKING Buffet room,#1!
likes.disliked: — Smokers and 2nd hand smoke,permeated EVERYTHING,IN THE PUBLIC AREAS!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: First I want to start off saying my family and I had an excellent time at LTI in Punta Cana. I have NO idea what the people who leave these bad reviews are thinking. Seriously they have to just be expecting way too much because we were in paradise. When we booked it and then read the reviews we were so afraid.
reviews.title: LTI Awesome!!!
Nice Time, But......
reviews.text: It is beautiful there and very clean and the staff works so hard it is almost sickening. I kept saying to my husband when the heck do they ever sleep. The poor people work so hard and dont even make that much money, but they seem sooo happy. The entertainment/activity staff is there first thing in the morning doing activities with people at the pool and on the beach all throughout the day and you still see them there at the night shows and at the club. Still you always see them smiling. Same with the wait staff and maintenance.

reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Time Or Money
reviews.text: We are a young married couple with 3 small daughters. We started off in a double room with a king size bed with 2 twin beds. We had a beautiful beach view. We made a comment about the room being a little bit small. Not a complaint but a comment to our TNT rep and all of a sudden LTI moved us to a Superior Ocean View 2 bedroom Family Suite free of charge. It was beautiful!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008
reviews.text: Originally we were in building 5 like everybody said to request it is the closest to the beach but nothing else. With the new room we ended up in building 3. That one is by far the absolute best building it is in between everything. The beach, the pool, the shops and the restaurants.
reviews.title: You can do better than LTI

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The king beds everybody complains so much about are very very comfortable I wanted to take it home with me I didnt even notice if it was two beds together or not, neither did I care (thats not what I went to the Caribbean for) The pillows werent that bad just ask for a bunch thats what we did.
reviews.title: not the best vacation

likes.disliked: — the service rooms and front desk stagg

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I spent last week at the LTI, and can't say enough good about it. The resort was beautiful - the vegetation very mature and exceptionally maintained.
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is second to none, and this resort is located on a very good section of the beach. The pool was spotless(as was the rest of the resort), and very large.
reviews.title: False Advertising at its Best!!

likes.liked: — Our waiter in the buffet We will miss him
likes.disliked: — Not a 4 star ,it was nothing you are expecting!

reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.text: The staff at this resort are among the happiest, friendliest and hard working employees that we have seen. They certainly add to the enjoyment of your vacation. I had heard mixed reviews about the Dominicans, but if this resort is any indication, they are wonderful people and made you feel welcome.

reviews.title: Fantastic time, beautiful weather, gourgeous beach!
reviews.text: The food was quite good- yes it's different than America, but isn't that why you travel? To encounter other cultures? If you want fast food for supper, stay in the US. One thing we really enjoyed was lots of fresh and very tasty lettuce and tomatoes- something we have yet to encounter in Cuba. I have to say I was a little disappointed in the "a la cartes". There really is only one, where you sit at a table and are waited on. The Italian restaurant, while very good, was mostly a buffet at supper time too. The other a la carte- the Seafood Restaurant was very good.The Bucanaaro at the beach had the tastiest grilled chicken I've had in a long time. We went there for lunch almost every day. My only complaint was that the wine was watered down. Sometimes it was better than others.One thing we really liked was that you could book your a la cartes in the morning each day, so if there was room , you could eat at one every night if you wanted to.Having said this, the buffet was probably one of the best we've had- lots of choice, and many dishes unique to the Dominican, if you wanted to try something different. The strengths are in the chicken and pork- any beef I sampled was quite tough and chewy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: There were plenty of loungers at the beach and the pool- it was never a problem getting one regardless of the time you got there.It was very hot the week we were there, and there are always lots of tiki huts to provide shade.
reviews.title: Has something for everyone: Retirees, Young Couples, and Families.

description: The VIK Hotel Arena Blanca is placed overlooking the incomparable beach of Bávaro, just 30 minutes away from the International Airport of Punta Cana. This hotel in Punta Cana was renovated in 2006 to be able to offer a wide variety of environments:
